intro: Calamus kebariensis, commonly known as the Kebarian calamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. Calamus kebariensis produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
